titleStmt.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to William F. Wharton, June 30, 1892

bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to William F. Wharton
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p:
Consulate of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, June 30, 1892.

William D. McCoy,
To the Assistant Secretary of State.

1. Digest of the Invoice Book.
2. Arrivals and Departures.
3. Record of Notarial Service.
4. Summary of Business.
5. Salary Account.
6. Contingent
6. Continget Expenses.
7. Abstract of Contingent Expenses.
8. Record of Treasury Fees.
9. Official Letters sent.
10. Aggregate of Fees received.
11. Names of Persons employed at Consulate.
12. General Quarterly Account.

Consulate of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, June 30, 1892.

Honorable William F. Wharton,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.
I have the honor to submit the Enclosures as my Quarterly Report to date.

William D. McCoy,
Minister-Resident and Consul-General.

1. Digest of the Invoice Book.
2. Arrivals and Departures.

3. Record of Notarial Service.
4. Summary of Business.
5. Salary Account.
6. Contingent Expenses
7. Abstract of Contingent Expenses.
8. Record of Treasury Fees.
9. Official Letters sent.
10. Aggregate of Fees received.
11. Names of Persons employed at the Consulate.
12. General Quarterly Account.
